body.p: Accordingly, the Board concluded that the scope of IFRS 2 includes transactions in which the entity cannot identify some or all of the specific goods or services received. If the value of the identifiable consideration received appears to be less than the fair value of the equity instruments granted or liability incurred, typically, this circumstance indicates that other consideration (ie unidentifiable goods or services) has been (or will be) received.
